abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Cheliff Irrigation
            Project for Algeria is unsatisfactory. The Banks
            performance is considered satisfactory while the Borrowers
            performance is considered unsatisfactory. The project
            encountered a large number of difficulties and issues which
            hampered project implementation. In addition to the security
            conditions which have progressively worsened during the last
            two years of the project, weak central and regional
            institutions and the lack of sound sectoral policies were
            the main constraints, not only at the level of the technical
            ministries in charge of the project but also at the level of
            the Ministry of Finance. Lessons learned from this project
            include: (a) the change of OPIs statutes into EPIC's
            (Etablissements Publics a caractere Industriel et
            Commercial) should have been more closely monitored by the
            Bank; (b) water tariff adjustment should have been a
            condition of loan effectiveness; (c) key indicators for
            project implementation should have been followed up by the
            Government and the Bank; greater care should have been given
            to the monitoring system to be put in place for the project;
            (d) the Bank should endeavor to agree on an authorized
            allocation deposited in the special account commensurate
            with the actual project financial needs. (e) a time-gap with
            the structural adjustment process negatively affected the
            project particular factors: shortage of foreign currency,
            shortage of construction materials, deficiency in the
            banking sector delaying creditors payments, cumbersome
            administrative procedures.
